claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A multi-panel figure showing (1) a map-like schematic of 9 Kaiser Permanente Northern California facilities of varying sizes within a service area, (2) grouping of similarly sized facilities into two randomized blocks (A and B), and (3) a table listing each facility, its block assignment, and the weekly alternation of two vaccine formulations labeled SD-IIV4 (standard-dose inactivated influenza vaccine) and RIV4 (quadrivalent recombinant influenza vaccine) over four weeks. The figure describes the cluster randomization design and weekly alternation of SD-IIV4 versus RIV4 across facilities but does not present any data on hemagglutinin antigen content or its comparison (e.g., 3× HA content) nor link antigen dose to immunogenicity, and therefore does not support the claim. Note: The text and table are legible and clear; no information on HA antigen content or immunogenicity is provided in this figure.
